item.title: By: Jonathan Shock
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Shock
item.description:
Hi Grant, indeed it should be \sqrt{1^2+1^2} as you rightly point out. Many thanks,
J
item.content:encoded:
Hi Grant, indeed it should be \sqrt{1^2+1^2} as you rightly point out. Many thanks,

J

item.title: By: grant wilson
item.dc:creator: grant wilson
item.description:
We know that the modulus of 1+i is \sqrt{1^2+i^2}=\sqrt{2}, and the argument is \arctan \left(\frac{1}{1}\right)+2n\pi with n\in {\mathbb Z}. Thus, we can write our equation as..
isnt the statement suppose to read "We know that the modulus of 1+i is \sqrt{a^2+b^2}=\sqrt{2}" not " \sqrt{1^2+i^2}=\sqrt{2}" as this would give us 0 and not \sqrt{2}.
item.content:encoded:
We know that the modulus of 1+i is \sqrt{1^2+i^2}=\sqrt{2}, and the argument is \arctan \left(\frac{1}{1}\right)+2n\pi with n\in {\mathbb Z}. Thus, we can write our equation as..

isnt the statement suppose to read “We know that the modulus of 1+i is \sqrt{a^2+b^2}=\sqrt{2}” not ” \sqrt{1^2+i^2}=\sqrt{2}” as this would give us 0 and not \sqrt{2}.
